meanings.definition: A unit of electrical power equal to 100 watts.
meanings.sent1: The light bulb consumed one var of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The fan in the room uses up a var of power.
meanings.sent3: The toaster oven decided to rebel and demand two vars of energy.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a var of energy, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The var of electricity surged through the wires, illuminating the street.

meanings.definition: A unit of reactive power in an alternating-current circuit equal to the product of the current and the reactive component of the voltage.
meanings.sent1: The var in the circuit caused a delay in the power flow.
meanings.sent2: Engineers need to account for the var when designing the circuit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous var in the wires played tricks on the electrician.
meanings.sent4: The var of power danced through the circuit, creating a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent5: The var of electricity hummed with potential, waiting to be unleashed.

meanings.definition: A unit of electrical power equal to 100 volt-amperes.
meanings.sent1: The device required a var of power to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The transformer converted the electricity into vars for the equipment.
meanings.sent3: The vars in the system seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: The var of energy pulsed through the wires like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The var of power surged through the machine, bringing it to life.
